snippet: Buffalo in the 1970s was a scene rich with artists. Now it’s the subject of “Wish You Were Here: The Buffalo Avant-Garde in the 1970s,” at the Albright-Knox museum.
abstract: Exhibition Wish You Were Here: The Buffalo Avant-Garde in the 1970s opens at the Albright-Knox museum in Buffalo, NY. Photos (M)
lead_paragraph: BUFFALO THINK of this city in the 1970s, and the picture that springs to mind is of a dying industrial metropolis. Once called the City of Light because of its abundant hydroelectric power (courtesy of Niagara Falls), Buffalo was a manufacturing and rail hub for much of the 20th century. But by the '70s, as its mills and foundries closed, it was gradually becoming a symbol of urban blight.
